page.title: 18 A POLICEMANS DAY IN W/BAY
page.content: Whitley Bay police station has just be- -en renovated at the cost of 80,000 pounds so as to remain able to operate officers 3/4 of whom are constables wi- -th the remainder special officers.An average PC on duty could expect to be injured at least once as there job in- -volves an increasing amount of foot patrolling replacing the usual car pa- -trolling of which W/B operates 3 cars at all times.The running and maintena- -nce of these is costly and this toge- -ther with cuts in spare resources and increases in manpower make patrolling on foot an economic and PR necessity. To become a policeman each man/woman trains for 13 weeks and works for a 2 year probationary period after which 2 weeks training is required every 4 yea- -rs.Once on the beat each man carries a Radio,truncheon,handcuffs and notebook and if needed back up is minutes away.
